name: dline
description: A sleek and simple calendar for terminal enthusiasts.
readme_summary: dLine is a command-line calendar tool written in Shell. It allows users to manage events, calculate timespans, and manage multiple calendars directly from the terminal. It offers dynamic and static calendar views, event calculation, and data management features.
key_features: Dynamic calendar view with color-coded categories and filtering
Event calculator for determining workdays between dates
Calendar data management (add, delete, update, clean)
Import/export events from various sources (TSV, GCA, OHA)
primary_use_case: Managing and interacting with a calendar from the command line.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled clockmaker meticulously crafting a large, intricate calendar using various tools and gears. The calendar displays dates and events, with some dates highlighted in different colors. The clockmaker uses a command-line interface projected onto a nearby screen to manage the calendar's data. Small code snippets and data visualizations float around the scene. The setting is a cozy workshop filled with clocks and calendars. The lighting is warm and inviting. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and vibrant colors.

name: sablier
description: Start your containers on demand, shut them down automatically when there's no activity. Docker, Docker Swarm Mode and Kubernetes compatible.
readme_summary: Sablier is a free and open-source software that automatically starts and stops containerized workloads based on demand and inactivity. It supports Docker, Docker Swarm, and Kubernetes, along with multiple reverse proxies, acting as a serverless platform for your own servers to optimize resource usage.
key_features: Supports Docker, Docker Swarm, and Kubernetes
Supports Apache APISIX, Caddy, Envoy, Istio, Nginx (NJS Module), Nginx (WASM Module), and Traefik reverse proxies
Automatic workload scaling upon first request with themable waiting page and hanging request strategy
Automatic workload scaling to zero after inactivity
primary_use_case: On-demand starting and automatic stopping of containerized workloads to conserve resources.
cover_image_prompt: A diligent gardener tending to a garden of servers. When a request arrives (represented by a watering can), the gardener activates a dormant server plant, causing it to bloom with digital flowers. After a period of inactivity, the gardener gently prunes the server, returning it to its dormant state. Small UI elements showing server status are subtly integrated into the garden landscape. The scene is set in a peaceful, sunny meadow with a clear blue sky. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and a clean, organized composition.

name: reddix
description: Reddix – Reddit, refined for the terminal.
readme_summary: Reddix is a terminal-based Reddit client written in Rust. It provides a refined Reddit experience within the terminal, offering features like image preview, video playback, gallery browsing, multi-account support, and keyboard-first navigation.
key_features: image preview based on kitty graphics protocol
video playback through mpv's Kitty integration
gallery browsing with inline navigation controls
primary_use_case: Browsing and interacting with Reddit from the terminal.
cover_image_prompt: A librarian sitting at a terminal, surrounded by towering shelves filled with digital scrolls representing Reddit threads. The librarian uses the terminal (Reddix) to quickly access and organize information, pulling relevant scrolls with ease. A small screen on the terminal displays a simplified Reddit interface. The scene is set in a futuristic library with soft, ambient lighting. Digital particles float around the librarian, representing the flow of information. The composition is clean and focused, with a warm color scheme. The image should be in 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and vibrant colors.

name: whitemax
description: Мод на мессенджер MAX, сокращающий сетевую активность приложения
readme_summary: The WhiteMAX Mod is a free and secure modification for the MAX messenger app, focused on reducing the application's network activity. It provides a modified APK for direct installation and instructions for building from source using tools like apktool and apksign.
key_features: Reduces network activity of MAX messenger
Offers pre-built APK for easy installation
Includes instructions for building from source
primary_use_case: Reducing network activity and enhancing the security of the MAX messenger application.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled clockmaker meticulously adjusting the gears inside a large, ornate hourglass, representing the MAX messenger application. The sand flowing through the hourglass is visibly reduced, symbolizing decreased network activity. Small screens embedded in the hourglass display network usage statistics. The clockmaker wears a white coat and uses precision tools. The scene is set in a clean, futuristic workshop with soft, diffused lighting. Digital particles flow around the hourglass, highlighting the data reduction. The composition is focused and balanced with a cool color scheme. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with intricate details.

name: oceanbase
description: The Fastest Distributed Database for Transactional, Analytical, and  AI Workloads.
readme_summary: OceanBase is a distributed relational database developed by Ant Group, designed for transactional, analytical, and AI workloads. It leverages the Paxos protocol for high availability and linear scalability, supporting features like vector search, transparent scalability, ultra-fast performance, cost efficiency, and real-time analytics.
primary_use_case: Distributed relational database for transactional, analytical, and AI workloads.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled architect overseeing the construction of a vast, interconnected city representing a database. The city's districts symbolize different functionalities (transactional, analytical, AI), with data flowing seamlessly between them via glowing pathways. The architect uses a holographic interface to manage the city's resources and ensure its stability. Small screens display real-time data metrics and system health. The scene is set in a futuristic environment with bright, optimistic lighting. The image should be in 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and intricate details.

name: slatedb
description: A cloud native embedded storage engine built on object storage.
readme_summary: SlateDB is an embedded storage engine built on a log-structured merge-tree (LSM-tree) architecture. It distinguishes itself by writing data to object storage (like S3, GCS), providing bottomless storage, high durability, and easy replication, trading off latency and API costs compared to local disk.
key_features: Batch writes to mitigate API costs
Asynchronous put operations with durability options
Standard LSM-tree caching techniques (in-memory block caches, compression, bloom filters, local SST disk caches)
primary_use_case: Embedded storage for applications requiring scalable and durable data storage in cloud environments.
cover_image_prompt: A diligent librarian meticulously archiving books (data) onto towering, cloud-shaped shelves. The librarian uses a special cart that automatically batches books before placing them on the shelves. A faint glow emanates from the shelves, indicating durability and accessibility. Small UI elements float nearby, showing data being written and retrieved. The repository name, 'SlateDB,' is subtly etched onto the librarian's cart. The scene is set in a bright, airy library with a modern design. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with clean lines and a vibrant color scheme.

name: speedtest-tracker
description: Speedtest Tracker is a self-hosted application that monitors the performance and uptime of your internet connection.
readme_summary: Speedtest Tracker is a self-hosted application designed to monitor the performance and uptime of an internet connection. It automates speed tests, captures detailed metrics like download/upload speeds and ping, and provides historical data and notifications to identify internet performance issues.
primary_use_case: Monitoring internet connection performance and uptime.
cover_image_prompt: A diligent gardener tending to a network of fiber optic cables growing like vines in a lush garden. The gardener uses a tablet displaying speed test results to monitor the health of each vine, pruning slow connections and nurturing fast ones. Small UI elements on the tablet show real-time data and historical trends. The garden is bathed in soft, natural light with glowing digital particles flowing through the cables. The repository name is subtly etched into a stone marker. The image should be in 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and rich details.
